metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13259 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in zsh before 5.6. Shebang lines exceeding 64 characters were truncated, potentially leading to an execve call to a program name that is a substring of the intended one.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13259` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zsh - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3
zsh-common - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3
zsh-static - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zsh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.1-1ubuntu2.3').
